title: Making Variable.grad a Variable breaks dropout backprop
body_html: In the backward pass of nn._functions.dropout, there's a call grad_output.mul(self.noise). But now that grad_output is a Variable rather than a Tensor, this fails because self.noise is a Tensor and Variables don't have mul implemented with other a Tensor. There may be similar problems in other modules; this one is currently blocking the OpenNMT example from running out of the box.

body: In the backward pass of `nn._functions.dropout`, there's a call `grad_output.mul(self.noise)`. But now that `grad_output` is a Variable rather than a Tensor, this fails because `self.noise` is a Tensor and Variables don't have `mul` implemented with `other` a `Tensor`. There may be similar problems in other modules; this one is currently blocking the OpenNMT example from running out of the box.
